Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi hit a tiebreaking, two-out single to help the White Sox win 3-2.
Jonathan Cannon pitched three-hit ball over six scoreless innings for Chicago.
Jack López hit his first career homer in the eighth inning.
Hunter Strickland gave up back-to-back doubles to Zach DeLoach and Bryan Ramos in the eighth inning.
Luis Robert Jr. was credited with an infield hit that tied the game.
Justin Anderson worked the ninth for his first save.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Benintendi commented on the long season and the potential for setting a record.
Jack López expressed his disappointment over his error that impacted the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Chicago White Sox remained tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the modern major league record of 120 losses in a season.
Fans chanted 'Sell the team!' throughout the game.
The White Sox have five games left to potentially set a new record for losses in a season.
